snippet: In a testimony to democratic values in Britain, the Scots will soon vote on whether they should be an independent country without the threat of reprisals.
abstract: Editorial observes the choice Scots face over whether to become independent of Great Britain, while largely free of acrimony, remains nonetheless complicated; notes both practical issues tied to economic benefits and larger questions of identity are at stake; says fact that question can be considered peaceably is testament to Britain's democratic values.
lead_paragraph: In a testimony to democratic values in Britain, the Scots will soon vote on whether they should be an independent country without the threat of reprisals.

headline.main: Scotland’s Identity, Put to a Vote
headline.print_headline: Scotland’s Identity, Put to a Vote
